intro: Cycnoches powellii, commonly known as Powell's cycnoches, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that produces small, oval-shaped leaves and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
